page.title: 19 SNEATH'S MILL (WINDMILL)
page.content: Sneath's Mill is just inside the parish boundary. Today it consists of the tower with some machinery inside it but no sails. The Mill was working at the time of the 1923 survey, but was derelict in 1953. It is the oldest mill in the county and is unique in being the only octagonal one. Above the south entrance of the mill is a date stone, "1779.T.D.AYLIFF.".On the inside first floor beam, facing the entrance is, "THOMAS AY..." also "IOH....RAM". On the upright beam of the first floor level is "T.A.1779" also "T.OLIVER,W. HILLRAM, 1783". It is going to be restored by the Civic Trust, but it will be several years before the work is finished.
